repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

did.unittitle: Elizabeth Danto Collection on the Sarah Lawrence College Strike and Teach-In against the United States' Invasion of Cambodia

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Elizabeth Danto in 2000. The accession number associated with this gift is 2000.021.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The four folders that comprise this collection are arranged alphabetically.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: In 1970 Elizabeth Danto was a student at Sarah Lawrence college. She participated in the Sarah Lawrence College strike and teach-in, one of thousands of such events at colleges and universities, occasioned by the U.S. invasion of Cambodia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains (non-official) student newsletters, principally Emanon, which provide a near-daily account of the events, a detailed list of teach-in programs and other student-created documents, and research materials on the invasion of Cambodia and the Vietnam war, principally Agency French Press dispatches.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Elizabeth Danto was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
